glsa.title: Weex: Format string vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: Weex contains a format string error that may be exploited by malicious servers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Weex is a non-interactive FTP client typically used to update web pages.

description.p: Ulf Harnhammar discovered a format string bug in Weex that can be triggered when it is first run (or when its cache files are rebuilt, using the -r option).

impact.p: An attacker could setup a malicious FTP server which, when accessed using Weex, could trigger the format string bug and end up executing arbitrary code with the rights of the user running Weex.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Weex users should upgrade to the latest version:
